lines.text: Are you all moved in?
There wasn't anything to move except us.
There's furniture and books and most of it I haven't even seen yet.

[to Ben]
There's a witch in the house. Ring the bell; she'll answer.
[Ben rings the bell, Medea answers]
What'd you do that for? You should've let the Witch answer it.
You need to stop calling her that or she'll cut your tongue out.
Elaine?
Yes Buck?
You really are a witch, aren't you?
Ask me no questions, and I'll tell you no lies.
Oh Cy, where are you?
Explaining how man survived the Pleistocene age.
How did he? And why?
All you have to do is find Elaine Zacharides.
I don't have to find her. She's the housekeeper.
The moving men are here again.
They won't wait?
Nope.
Not till tomorrow?
Nope.

[making a birthday wish]
I wish we owned our own house, and all our furniture that nobody could take away.
[wind blows through the windows and blows out the candles, somebody knocks at the door]
That was Emilio.
Who?
Emilio! He killed his wife, his mother-in-law and his sister-in-law with a meat cleaver. Whack! Whack! Whack! You'd better stand over there
[points to wall]
Why?
He doesn't mess up the kitchen often, but when he does, WOW!
[meat cleaver hits the wall]
. Now Emilio is through.
Now *I'm* through
[takes off apron and storms out of the kitchen]

[as Ben walks in the door]
Ben, I found it!
[grabs the railing and shakes it to reveal the hidden area in the stairs]
Good boy! Have you told anyone else about this?
Course not! Let's tell them now.
[Runs towards the dining room; Ben grabs his arm stopping him]
Ow! You're hurting!
Sorry, Buck. We can't tell them yet.
But we're moving out tomorrow!

[Ben has just brought Medea home]
That was a wonderful evening Ben, thanks. How about some coffee before you go?
No, thanks. Not tonight, I sure wish you and your family were staying somewhere else; this place gives me the creeps.
Oh don't start with that again.
Well I worry about you, Medea. Just for me will you try to be a little careful?
For you, I'll pull the covers over my head tonight.

[smiling]
See you tomorrow?
I hope so. Good night, Ben.
Goodnight
[leaves the house]
